title: Scriabin-Poeme De L'Extase;Bartok-Orchestral Works-Boulez (1994)
description:
- Composer: Bela Bartok, Alexander Scriabin (both in modernism music)

- Works: Bartok - The Wooden Prince, Music for Strings, Percussion and Celesta, Dance Suite / Scriabin - Le Poeme De L'Extase

- Played by: Pierre Boulez and the new York Philharmonic

- Record label and date: Sony, 1968-74 (it's a compilation, so each piece was recorded at a different time)

- My comment: This is a 2-CDs box that compiles some of Bartok's orchestral works and Scriabin's Poeme de l'Extase (Poem of Ecstasy). The Bartok's pieces exist on other editions at Sony, so not rare nor unique. However, the Poeme de l'Extase by Scriabin is a first release! It is an absolutely glorious rendition of Scriabin mystical and sensual masterpiece. Don't get me wrong, the Bartok's are also beautiful, but I think the real star of this box is Scriabin's.

- Tracks :

Disc One 	
1 	[Bartok] The Wooden Prince, Op. 13 (Sz 60) 	

Disc Two 	
2 	[Bartok] Music For Strings, Percussion And Celesta (Sz 106) 	
3 	[Bartok] Dance Suite (Sz 77) 	
4 	[Scriabin] Le Poeme De L'Extase, Op. 54
